title: COAST ORB / arno van eyck after
description: Afterthought reaction orbital to those flyers, man. Do it. Talk to your stupid brain.

dialogueTree.title: Inland Empire: "One of the flyers has gotten stuck..."
dialogueTree.english: One of the flyers has gotten stuck to the branches of a small brush. The sound of it flapping in the wind is an echo of Van Eyck.
dialogueTree.polish: Jedna z ulotek utknęła wśród gałązek niewielkiego krzewu. Odgłos jej łopotania na wietrze jest niczym echo Van Eycka.
dialogueTree.belarusian: Адна з улётак затрымалася сярод галін невялікага кусту. Гук яе лопацення на ветры — як водгулле Ван Эйка.

links.title: You: "Grab it quickly."
links.english: Grab it quickly.
links.polish: Złap ją szybko.
links.belarusian: Хутка злаві яе.

links.title: Inland Empire: "As your hand reaches for the small..."
links.english: As your hand reaches for the small rectangle of glossy paper, it snaps free from the branch...
links.polish: Kiedy twoja ręka wyciąga się ku małemu kwadratowi z lśniącego papieru, uwalnia się on z objęć gałązki...
links.belarusian: Калі твоя рука працягваецца да маленькага квадрата з бліскучай паперы, ён вызваляецца з абдымкаў галінкі...

links.title: Inland Empire: "...and is swept away, out of existe..."
links.english: ...and is swept away, out of existence.
links.polish: ...i odlatuje nagle z wiatrem, jakby przestał istnieć.
links.belarusian: ...і раптам адлятае з ветрам, як быццам перастаў існаваць.

links.title: You: "What the shit?"
links.english: What the shit?
links.polish: Co do cholery?
links.belarusian: Што за халера?

links.title: Inland Empire: "Cold drops of rain fall onto your o..."
links.english: Cold drops of rain fall onto your outstretched hand. A slight tremble passes through it...
links.polish: Na twoją wyciągniętą rękę padają chłodne krople deszczu. Przebiega ją lekki dreszcz...
links.belarusian: На тваю працягнутую руку падаюць халодныя кроплі дажджу. Прабягае лёгкае дрыжаннне...

links.title: Shivers: "A GLIMPSE INTO THE PAST"
links.english: A GLIMPSE INTO THE PAST
links.polish: WEJRZENIE W PRZESZŁOŚĆ.
links.belarusian: ВЗІРНЕННЕ Ў МІНУЛАЕ.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant is looking at the sp..."
links.english: The lieutenant is looking at the spot you were reaching for. "Did you notice something important?"
links.polish: Porucznik spogląda na miejsce, w którego kierunku sięgałeś. „Zauważyłeś coś istotnego?”
links.belarusian: Лейтэнант глядзіць у той бок, куды вы паказвалі. "Ці заўважылі вы нешта істотнае?"

links.title: You: ""Kim, I think I'm seeing Van Eyck p..."
links.english: "Kim, I think I'm seeing Van Eyck posters everywhere now."
links.polish: „Kim, mam wrażenie, że wszędzie widzę teraz plakaty Van Eycka”.
links.belarusian: "Кім, мне здаецца, што я цяпер усюды бачу плакаты Ван Эйка".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Okay. Well. I'm not going to ask w..."
links.english: "Okay. Well. I'm not going to ask who Van Eyck is. I'm just going to assume it's your business and move on, okay?" He raises his collar.
links.polish: „W porządku. Cóż... Nie zapytam, kim jest Van Eyck. Po prostu założę, że to twoja sprawa i przejdę nad tym do porządku dziennego, dobrze?” – pyta, stawiając kołnierz kurtki.
links.belarusian: "У парадку. Ну... Я не буду пытацца, хто такі Ван Эйк. Проста дапушчу, што гэта твая справа, і прайду міма гэтага, добра?" — спытаў ён, падымаючы каўнер курткі.

links.title: Inland Empire: "And so all our lives become but a f..."
links.english: And so all our lives become but a faded memory, an ephemeral vision of a Van Eyck concert flyer... blink or you'll miss it.
links.polish: I tak oto nasze życia stają się li tylko wyblakłym wspomnieniem, efemeryczną wizją ulotki reklamującej koncert Van Eycka. Mrugniesz, a wszystko przegapisz.
links.belarusian: І так вось нашы жыцці становяцца толькі вылінелым успамінам, эфемернай візіяй улёткі, што рэкламуе канцэрт Ван Эйка. Міргнеш — і ўсё прапусціш.

links.title: You: ""No... I don't think so. It was jus..."
links.english: "No... I don't think so. It was just a reflection or something. Never mind."
links.polish: „Nie, nie wydaje mi się. To chyba tylko jakieś odbicie czy coś takiego. Nieistotne”.
links.belarusian: "Не, мне так не здаецца. Гэта, напэўна, толькі нейкае адлюстраванне ці нешта такое. Няўжо істотнае".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "He nods. "Let's get going. We have..."
links.english: He nods. "Let's get going. We have a case to solve."
links.polish: Kiwa głową. „Ruszajmy. Mamy sprawę do rozwiązania...”
links.belarusian: Ківае галавой. "Пойдзем. У нас ёсць справа для вырашэння..."

links.title: You: "Am I hallucinating?"
links.english: Am I hallucinating?
links.polish: Czy ja mam halucynacje?
links.belarusian: Ці ў мяне галюцынацыі?

links.title: Inland Empire: "No."
links.english: No.
links.polish: Nie.
links.belarusian: Не.

links.title: Endurance: "Yes. It's likely triggered by a foc..."
links.english: Yes. It's likely triggered by a focal epileptic seizure in your temporal lobe.
links.polish: Tak. To prawdopodobnie efekt skroniowego ataku padaczki.
links.belarusian: Так. Гэта, верагодна, вынік часовага нападу эпілепсіі.

links.title: You: "Is it dangerous?"
links.english: Is it dangerous?
links.polish: Czy to niebezpieczne?
links.belarusian: Ці гэта небяспечна?

links.title: Endurance: "I don't know... probably. I'm not a..."
links.english: I don't know... probably. I'm not a doctor.
links.polish: Nie wiem. Chyba tak. Nie jestem lekarzem.
links.belarusian: Не ведаю. Напэўна так. Я не ўрач.

links.title: You: "Oh my god, I'm going to die!"
links.english: Oh my god, I'm going to die!
links.polish: Boże, ja zaraz umrę!
links.belarusian: Божа, я зараз памру!

links.title: Endurance: "Yeah, probably, one day. But not th..."
links.english: Yeah, probably, one day. But not this very minute.
links.polish: Tak, kiedyś to nastąpi. Ale nie w tym momencie.
links.belarusian: Так, калісьці гэта адбудзецца. Але не на гэты момант.

links.title: You: "Okay, I'm done with this. [Finish t..."
links.english: Okay, I'm done with this. [Finish thought.]
links.polish: Dobra, dość już mam tego. [Zakończ myśl].
links.belarusian: Добра, дастаткова ўжо гэтага. [Скончы думку].

links.title: Inland Empire: "At the back of your head you feel t..."
links.english: At the back of your head you feel the rapid beat of anodic music... then it fades away.
links.polish: Gdzieś z tyłu głowy słyszysz szybki rytm muzyki anodic... który po chwili cichnie.
links.belarusian: Дзе-небудзь у задняй частцы галавы ты чуеш хуткі рытм музыкі анодык... які праз момант сціхае.

links.title: You: ""Never mind. Let's get going." [Fin..."
links.english: "Never mind. Let's get going." [Finish thought.]
links.polish: „Nieważne. Chodźmy już”. [Zakończ myśl].
links.belarusian: "Не важна. Пайшлі ўжо". [Скончыць думку].

links.title: Inland Empire: "Flakes of snow fall onto your outst..."
links.english: Flakes of snow fall onto your outstretched hand. A slight tremble passes through it...
links.polish: Na twoją wyciągniętą rękę padają płatki śniegu. Przebiega ją lekki dreszcz...
links.belarusian: На тваю выцягнутую руку падаюць сняжынкі. Па ёй прабягае лёгкі дрыжык...

links.title: Inland Empire: "Your outstretched hand basks in the..."
links.english: Your outstretched hand basks in the warm spring sun.
links.polish: Twoja wyciągnięta ręka chwyta promienie ciepłego, wiosennego słońca.
links.belarusian: Твая працягнутая рука лавіць промні цёплага, вясновага сонца.

links.title: Inland Empire: "Things in the night are not what th..."
links.english: Things in the night are not what they seem to be...
links.polish: W nocy wiele rzeczy jest innych, niż mogłoby się zdawać...
links.belarusian: Уначы шмат рэчаў выглядаюць іначай, чым магло б здавацца...

links.title: You: "Did that really happen just now?"
links.english: Did that really happen just now?
links.polish: Czy to się naprawdę właśnie stało?
links.belarusian: Ці гэта сапраўды толькі што адбылося?

links.title: Inland Empire: "Cold drops of rain fall onto your o..."
links.english: Cold drops of rain fall onto your outstretched hand. A slight tremble passes through it...
links.polish: Na twoją wyciągniętą rękę padają chłodne krople deszczu. Przebiega ją lekki dreszcz...
links.belarusian: На тваю працягнутую руку падаюць халодныя кроплі дажджу. Яе прабягае лёгкі дрыжыкі...

links.title: Shivers: "IT HAPPENED ONCE; LONG AGO"
links.english: IT HAPPENED ONCE; LONG AGO
links.polish: STAŁO SIĘ TO RAZ, DAWNO TEMU.
links.belarusian: ГЭТА АДБЫЛАСЯ АДЗІН РАЗ, ДАЎНО.

links.title: Inland Empire: "Large flakes of snow fall onto your..."
links.english: Large flakes of snow fall onto your outstretched hand. A slight tremble passes through it...
links.polish: Na twoją wyciągniętą rękę padają wielkie płatki śniegu. Przebiega ją lekki dreszcz...
links.belarusian: На тваю працягнутую руку падаюць вялікія сняжынкі. Прабягае яе лёгкі дрыжыкі...

links.title: Inland Empire: "Your outstretched hand casts a deep..."
links.english: Your outstretched hand casts a deep shadow on the ground...
links.polish: Twoja wyciągnięta ręka rzuca na ziemię głęboki cień...
links.belarusian: Твая выцягнутая рука кідае на зямлю глыбокую цень...

links.title: Inland Empire: "The shadows play tricks on your min..."
links.english: The shadows play tricks on your mind...
links.polish: Cienie płatają figle twoim zmysłom...
links.belarusian: Цені жартуюць з тваімі адчуваннямі...

links.title: You: "[Ignore thought.]"
links.english: [Ignore thought.]
links.polish: [Zignoruj myśl].
links.belarusian: [Ігнараваць думку].

links.title: Inland Empire: "In the back of your head, you feel..."
links.english: In the back of your head, you feel the rapid beat of anodic music... then it fades away.
links.polish: Gdzieś z tyłu głowy słyszysz szybki rytm muzyki anodic... który po chwili cichnie.
links.belarusian: Недзе ў цёмных вуглах розуму ты чуеш хуткі рытм анадычнай музыкі... які праз момант сціхае.
